ar.content: Training Stress Score (TSS): Complete Guide for Runners Published: January 27, 2025 | Updated: January 29, 2025 Quick Answer Training Stress Score (TSS) is a metric that quantifies workout intensity and duration into a single number representing training load. For running (rTSS), it's calculated as: Duration (hours) Ã— Intensity FactorÂ² Ã— 100 , where Intensity Factor = Workout Pace / Critical Running Speed. Key Facts: 1-hour workout at threshold pace = 100 TSS Tracks cumulative fitness (CTL), fat

en.title: 80/20 Training Rule: Complete Guide to Intensity Distribution
en.description: Master the 80/20 training rule: science-based intensity distribution with 80% easy, 20% hard. Sample weekly schedules, tracking methods, and proven results.
en.content:

{% block content %} 80/20 Training Rule: The Secret to Running Faster How elite runners train: 80% easy, 20% hardâ€”and why you should too What is the 80/20 Training Rule? The 80/20 training rule states that runners should do approximately 80% of their training at low intensity (easy pace, Zone 1-2 ) and 20% at moderate to high intensity (Zone 3-5). en.content: Critical Running Speed (CRS) The Foundation of Data-Driven Running Training Key Takeaways What: Critical running speed (CRS) is your maximum sustainable running paceâ€”the aerobic threshold where you can maintain effort for 30+ minutes How to Calculate: Perform 400m and 200m time trials, then use: CRS = (400m time - 200m time) / 2 for pace per 100m Why It Matters: CRS enables personalized training zones , accurate TSS calculations , and objective fitness tracking Typical Values: Elite runners: 0:5

en.content:

{% block content %} Lactate Threshold Testing: Complete Guide for Runners How to find your lactate threshold and use it to optimize marathon training What is Lactate Threshold? Lactate threshold (LT) is the exercise intensity at which lactate begins to accumulate in your bloodstream faster than your body can clear it. It represents the fastest pace you can sustain for extended periods (30-60 minutes) before fatigue forces you to slow down. For distance runners, lactate

{% block content %} Polarized Training for Runners: Train at Two Extremes Why elite endurance athletes avoid the middleâ€”training very easy and very hard What is Polarized Training? Polarized training is an intensity distribution model where runners spend approximately 75-85% of training time at low intensity ( Zone 1-2 ) and 10-20% at high intensity (Zone 5), while minimizing time in moderate intensity zones (Zone 3-4). {% block content %} Gait Analysis for Runners: Complete Guide How to analyze and optimize your running form for better performance and injury prevention What is Gait Analysis? Running gait analysis is the systematic evaluation of biomechanical patterns during running, including foot strike, stride mechanics, body alignment, and movement efficiency. It helps identify form issues that may cause injury or limit performance, providing actionable insights for improvement. M

{% block content %} Lactate Threshold Testing: Complete Guide for Runners How to find your lactate threshold and use it to optimize marathon training What is Lactate Threshold? Lactate threshold (LT) is the exercise intensity at which lactate begins to accumulate in your bloodstream faster than your body can clear it. Polarized training is an intensity distribution model where runners spend approximately 75-85% of training time at low intensity ( Zone 1-2 ) and 10-20% at high intensity (Zone 5), while minimizing time in moderate intensity zones (Zone 3-4). Running cadence (also called stride rate or turnover) is the number of steps you take per minute while running. It's measured by counting footstrikes of one foot and multiplying by two, or counting total steps for both feet combined. hi.content: Free Running TSS Calculator Calculate Training Stress Score for running workouts - The only free sTSS calculator What is Running TSS (sTSS)? Running Training Stress Score (sTSS) quantifies the training load of a running workout by combining intensity and duration. It's adapted from cycling's TSS methodology, using your Critical Run Speed (CRS) as the threshold pace. A 1-hour workout at CRS pace = 100 sTSS. {% block content %} Zone 3 Tempo Runs: Training in the Sweet Spot How to use moderate-intensity tempo runs to build aerobic strength and race readiness What are Zone 3 Tempo Runs? Zone 3 tempo runs are moderate-intensity sustained efforts run at approximately 70-80% of max heart rate or 85-95% of lactate threshold pace . Aturan latihan 80/20 menyatakan bahwa pelari harus melakukan sekitar 80% latihan mereka dengan intensitas rendah (kecepatan mudah, Zona 1-2 ) dan 20% dengan intensitas sedang hingga tinggi (Zona 3-5). {% block content %} Lactate Threshold Testing: Complete Guide for Runners How to find your lactate threshold and use it to optimize marathon training What is Lactate Threshold? Lactate threshold (LT) is the exercise intensity at which lactate begins to accumulate in your bloodstream faster than your body can clear it. Polarized training is an intensity distribution model where runners spend approximately 75-85% of training time at low intensity ( Zone 1-2 ) and 10-20% at high intensity (Zone 5), while minimizing time in moderate intensity zones (Zone 3-4). ja.description: Track Critical Running Speed, Training Stress Score, and performance metrics with Run Analytics. Science-based iOS app for runners, triathletes & coaches. 7-day free trial.
ja.content:
{% extends "base.html" %}

{% block content %} Zone 3 Tempo Runs: Training in the Sweet Spot How to use moderate-intensity tempo runs to build aerobic strength and race readiness What are Zone 3 Tempo Runs? Zone 3 tempo runs are moderate-intensity sustained efforts run at approximately 70-80% of max heart rate or 85-95% of lactate threshold pace . They fall between easy aerobic runs (Zone 2) and hard threshold workouts (Zone 4), occupying the "tempo" zone that builds aerobic strength without exc

{% block content %} Lactate Threshold Testing: Complete Guide for Runners How to find your lactate threshold and use it to optimize marathon training What is Lactate Threshold? Lactate threshold (LT) is the exercise intensity at which lactate begins to accumulate in your bloodstream faster than your body can clear it. It represents the fastest pace you can sustain for extended periods (30-60 minutes) before fatigue forces you to slow down. For distance runners, lactate

Polarized training is an intensity distribution model where runners spend approximately 75-85% of training time at low intensity ( Zone 1-2 ) and 10-20% at high intensity (Zone 5), while minimizing time in moderate intensity zones (Zone 3-4). Running cadence (also called stride rate or turnover) is the number of steps you take per minute while running. ko.content: Free Running TSS Calculator Calculate Training Stress Score for running workouts - The only free sTSS calculator What is Running TSS (sTSS)? Running Training Stress Score (sTSS) quantifies the training load of a running workout by combining intensity and duration. It's adapted from cycling's TSS methodology, using your Critical Run Speed (CRS) as the threshold pace. A 1-hour workout at CRS pace = 100 sTSS. Testing your VO2max (maximal oxygen uptake) provides an objective measure of your aerobic fitness and helps guide training decisions. Whether you're using lab testing, field tests, or smartwatch estimates, understanding your VO2max allows you to: Set appropriate training zones based on your physiology Track fitness impr

ko.title: What-Is-Vo2Max - Run Analytics - Running Analytics App | Critical Running Speed, TSS, CTL/ATL/TSB for iOS
ko.description: Track Critical Running Speed, Training Stress Score, and performance metrics with Run Analytics. Science-based iOS app for runners, triathletes & coaches. 7-day free trial.
ko.content: What is VO2max? Complete Guide for Runners Your aerobic capacity explainedâ€”why it matters and how to improve it | Updated: January 29, 2025 Quick Answer VO2max (maximal oxygen uptake) is the maximum amount of oxygen your body can utilize during intense exercise, measured in ml/kg/min. It represents the ceiling of your aerobic capacity and directly predicts running performance. Key Facts: Elite marathoners: 70-85 ml/kg/min (men), 60-75 ml/kg/min (women) Recreational runners: 45-55 ml/kg/min (men)

ms.description: Panduan lengkap peraturan latihan 80/20: 80% mudah, 20% keras. Pelajari bukti saintifik, cara melaksana, faedah, dan kesilapan biasa. Untuk pelari semua peringkat.

{% block content %} Peraturan Latihan 80/20: Rahsia untuk Berlari Lebih Pantas Cara atlet elit berlatih: 80% mudah, 20% kerasâ€”dan mengapa anda juga perlu melakukannya Apakah Peraturan Latihan 80/20? Peraturan latihan 80/20 menyatakan bahawa pelari seharusnya melakukan kira-kira 80% daripada latihan mereka pada intensiti rendah (rentak mudah, Zon 1-2 ) dan 20% pada intensiti sederhana hingga tinggi (Zon 3-5). {% block content %} Fasa Pembinaan Asas: Asas Kejayaan Berlari Cara membina asas aerobik yang menyokong latihan lebih pantas dan mencegah kecederaan Apakah Pembinaan Asas? Pembinaan asas adalah fasa latihan asas di mana pelari membangunkan kapasiti aerobik melalui larian volum tinggi, intensiti rendah. ms.content: Run Analytics berbanding Aplikasi Larian Lain - Perbandingan Ciri Bagaimana Run Analytics berbanding dengan Strava, TrainingPeaks, Final Surge, dan platform penjejakan larian lain Mengapa Larian Memerlukan Analitik Khusus Aplikasi kecergasan umum seperti Strava dan TrainingPeaks cemerlang dalam berbasikal dan larian, tetapi larian memerlukan metrik yang berbeza . Dapatkan Sokongan & Kongsi Maklum Balas Pasukan Run Analytics komited untuk membantu pelari kompetitif dan ahli triatlon mendapat manfaat maksimum daripada data latihan mereka. ms.description: Kalkulator CRS percuma untuk pelari. Kira Kelajuan Larian Kritikal daripada masa ujian 400m dan 200m. Dapatkan zon latihan diperibadikan, kadar ambang, dan ramalan perlumbaan. Berdasarkan kajian Wakayoshi.
ms.content: Kelajuan Larian Kritikal (CRS) Asas Latihan Larian Berasaskan Data Perkara Penting Apa itu: Kelajuan larian kritikal (CRS) ialah kadar larian maksimum mampan andaâ€”ambang aerobik di mana anda boleh mengekalkan usaha selama 30+ minit Cara Mengira: Lakukan ujian masa 400m dan 200m, kemudian gunakan: CRS = (masa 400m - masa 200m) / 2 untuk kadar setiap 100m Mengapa Ia Penting: CRS membolehkan zon latihan yang diperibadikan, pengiraan TSS yang tepat, dan penjejakan kecergasan objektif Nilai Tipikal:

Ia diadaptasi daripada metodologi TSS basikal, menggunakan Kelajuan Larian Kritikal (CRS) anda sebagai rentak ambang. Senaman 1 jam pada rentak CRS = 100 sTSS. Kalkulator sTSS Percuma Kira tekanan latihan untuk mana-mana senaman larian.

{% block content %} 80/20 Training Rule: Het Geheim om Sneller te Lopen Hoe elite hardlopers trainen: 80% rustig, 20% hardâ€”en waarom jij dat ook zou moeten doen Wat is de 80/20 Training Rule? De 80/20 training rule stelt dat hardlopers ongeveer 80% van hun training op lage intensiteit moeten doen (rustig tempo, Zone 1-2 ) en 20% op matige tot hoge intensiteit (Zone 3-5). Dit principe, ondersteund door decennia van onderzoek en toegepast door elite hardlopers wereldwijd

pt.title: 8020-Training-Rule - Run Analytics - Running Analytics App | Critical Running Speed, TSS, CTL/ATL/TSB for iOS
pt.description: Track Critical Running Speed, Training Stress Score, and performance metrics with Run Analytics. Science-based iOS app for runners, triathletes & coaches. 7-day free trial.
pt.content:
{% extends "base.html" %}

{% block content %} 80/20 Training Rule: The Secret to Running Faster How elite runners train: 80% easy, 20% hardâ€”and why you should too What is the 80/20 Training Rule? The 80/20 training rule states that runners should do approximately 80% of their training at low intensity (easy pace, Zone 1-2 ) and 20% at moderate to high intensity (Zone 3-5). {% block content %} How to Test VO2max: Complete Guide Laboratory, field, and smartwatch methods to measure your aerobic capacity Why Test Your VO2max? sw.description: Pata mawasiliano na timu ya Run Analytics. Maswali, maoni, au haja ya msaada? Tuko hapa kusaidia wakimbizi na wabunifu wote.

Iwe una maswali kuhusu uchambuzi wa kukimbia, unahitaji msaada wa kipimo cha CRS, unataka kuripoti hitilafu, au una mapendekezo ya vipengele, tuko hapa kusaidia. tl.title: 80/20 Training Rule para sa Runners - Low Intensity vs High Intensity
tl.description: Kompletong gabay sa 80/20 training rule para sa endurance runners. Matuto kung paano mag-balance ng 80% easy running at 20% high-intensity work para sa optimal performance gains. May kasamang sample plans at zone distribution.
tl.content:
{% extends "base.html" %}

{% block content %} Alituntuning 80/20 sa Pagsasanay: Ang Lihim sa Mas Mabilis na Pagtakbo Paano nagsasanay ang mga elite runner: 80% madali, 20% mabigatâ€”at bakit dapat mo ring gawin ito Ano ang Alituntuning 80/20 sa Pagsasanay? Ang alituntuning 80/20 sa pagsasanay ay nagsasaad na ang mga runner ay dapat gumawa ng humigit-kumulang 80% ng kanilang pagsasanay sa mababang intensidad (madaling bilis, Zone 1-2 ) at 20% sa katamtaman hanggang mataas na intensidad (Zone 3-5).

tl.title: Tungkol sa Run Analytics - Science-Based Running Analytics Platform
